revised_title: Observation of Mercury's Right Ascension and Declination Out of the Meridian
tldr: In 1786, John Smeaton made an observation of Mercury's right ascension and declination out of the meridian using an equatorial micrometer he invented. He also investigated a method to account for refraction in such observations. Smeaton's innovative instrument allowed for more accurate measurements and stability, which contributed to the improvement of astronomical instruments.
